DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalization Ratio Result Upper Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the upper limit of normal of the International Normalization Ratio value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalization Ratio Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for the International Normalization ratio, a system established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests where results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: System established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests. Under this system, results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A system, commonly called the INR, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivity index (ISI) for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combination utilized to perform the test; the ratio of a patient's clotting time to the lab's mean reference value is normalized against the ISI. (from medterms.com and medicine.ucsf.edu)

ValueDomain.preferredName: International Normalization Ratio Lab Upper Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the upper limit of normal of the International Normalization Ratio value

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
